intro: Nenax cinerea, commonly known as the gray nenax, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and produces small, pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Nenax cinerea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
